message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of locating the source of an epidemic diffusion process from a sparse set of sensors, under noise. This problem involves information theory (cs.IT) as the algorithm needs to make queries to the sensors to obtain information about the shortest path between the sensor and the source. The problem also involves graph theory and algorithms (cs.DS) as the source and sensors are located on a graph and the algorithm needs to make decisions about which sensors to query. The problem can also be seen as a system identification problem (cs.SI) as the algorithm needs to identify the source of the epidemic diffusion process. The problem can also be seen as a control systems problem (cs.SY) as the algorithm needs to make decisions about which sensors to query in order to control the epidemic diffusion process. Finally, the problem involves machine learning (cs.LG) as the algorithm needs to learn from the information obtained from the sensors to locate the source.
